Thanks for reading here‚Äôs the sequence of events. Through normal time

Genius scientist falls in love

Relationship ruined by three strangers 

Builds time machine (in space) to stop breakup from happening.

Whilst building the time machine he has three children with another woman.

Eventually realises that his three children are the people who ruined his relationship.

Genius scientist claims that he is using the time machine to save to world. But just wants to leave.

His three children grow up and try find there father. Unable to find the older version they intercept the original father. And accidentally ruin his relationship with ‚Äúmistress‚Äù

Mother of three children travels back in time. Presumably to find her children and because it‚Äôs better then living in space.

I think I like the message and energy. But here‚Äôs the secret to writing lyrics ‚Äúless is more‚Äù if you say something out right it doesn‚Äôt work as well as hinting at it.

For example you could sing ‚ÄúToday was the worst day of my life‚Äù plain and simple

Or (my advice) ‚ÄúToday wasn‚Äôt that great‚Äù

Even though your not outright saying you are miserable, (I find) the second one much more moving. 

I hope this makes sense and helps. Keep writing!

Although I can‚Äôt here the vocal I can make out the melody. I really think you could push yourself for more melodic invention. (For me) a good thing to do is listen to a lot of heavily melodic pop, (of Montreal, Jon Brion, Polyphonic spree) listen to the melodies and think what am I feeling right now. Eventually (for me) it seeped in how to not only create an emotion but catch the ear. Everyone‚Äôs naturally melodic but you have to work out that part of the brain like a muscle. My humble advice.
